resources.string: An exception occurred. Share infos using…

Enabling this makes it possible to automate the freezing of apps.

This has the following advantages:
 - The user does not have to do this himself: It is way faster and the user does not have to care about how to do it.
 - Users with physical disabilities just need to start the shortcut "autofreeze" (by speech recognition, for example). Then they can freeze all apps automatically. 

SuperFreeze just uses the accessibility service to tap on "Force Stop", "OK", "Back" and to evaluate the result of these interactions.
Accessibility service is not available on your Android version.
Freeze this app if it has not been used for a longer time.
